abstract.p: Councilman Noach Dear letter on Aug 25 article calls for moratorium on increasing flights at La Guardia Airport pending studies on adverse impact on noise and pollution levels in area

The increased volume of flights into La Guardia Airport is a serious issue (news article, Aug. 25). But extensive delays are only one aspect of the growing traffic at our airports; aircraft-related noise and pollution adversely affect the health and quality of life of New Yorkers.
Congress showed a lack of concern for travelers and airport-area residents alike by recently enacting a law that will allow as many as 500 additional flights per day into La Guardia.

The New York City Council's Transportation Committee has introduced legislation to address these issues. There should be a moratorium on increasing flights at La Guardia Airport until studies have been commissioned to detail the adverse impact on noise and pollution levels, as well as on vehicular traffic in the surrounding neighborhoods.
NOACH DEAR Chmn., Transportation Committee New York City Council New York, Aug. 25, 2000
